trans-unit.source: Represents a thread-safe, read-only collection of address headers.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection> can be initialized with an <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> set of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader> objects and then searched for a header with a specific qualified name using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.FindHeader%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
To find all of the headers with a specific qualified name, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.FindAll%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.AddHeadersTo%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message%29> method is used to add headers to the headers of a specified message.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection"></xref> class from an enumerable set of address headers.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> set of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> objects used to initialize the collection.
One of the address headers in the addressHeaders parameter is `null`.
Adds the headers in the collection to the headers of a specified message.

This inserts the headers from the current collection into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders> associated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> and accessible through the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.Headers%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> to which the headers are added.
message is `null`.
Finds all the address headers in the collection with the specified name and namespace.
The name of the address header to be found.
The namespace of the address header to be found.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> that contains all the headers in the collection with the specified name and namespace.
name or ns is `null`.
Finds the first address header in the collection with a specified name and namespace.

If you need to find all the address headers in the collection with the specified name and namespace, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeaderCollection.FindAll%28System.String%2CSystem.String%29> method instead.
<xref:System.ArgumentException> is not the ideal exception type when there is more than one header in the collection.
Callers of this method should take care to handle this exception when the collection contains multiple entries with the same name and namespace.
The name of the address header to be found.
The namespace of the address header to be found.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressHeader"></xref> in the collection with the specified name and namespace.
name or ns is `null`.
There is more than one header that has the specified name and ns.
